title: Is it just me or does Riot have to do one extreme or the other?
body:
Seriously, its either, buff buff buff buff buff on a character, or nerf nerf nerf nerf nerf, until they're either called OP as fuck and get that nerf nerf nerf nerf, or completely unviable and everyone wants them buffed.

Even when they only buff or nerf them once, or even just rework, it seems they go overboard. I mean, I'm pretty new(only several months here) but in the nerfs and buffs I've seen as well as heard of it seems like they can't just nerf'em or buff'em once, or nerf or buff one tiny thing, and then leave it at that, they gotta nerf or buff their whole kit and make everyone hate that champ. It seems the only rework that's really been good, or so I've heard, is Sion who everyone praises the creator for finally getting a good rework or whatnot.

As for Shyvana, this item is made for her. I'll just list off what the second hit does for her before considering itemisation.

* Reduces Q cooldown
* Extends W duration
* Applies W on-hit damage
* Applies E on-hit damage
* Generates extra fury for R

Then you can factor in Wit's End and BotRK both being rather strong items on Shyvana and you start to see how strong this item will be for her.

Warrior junglers are kinda dead, with Rek'sai being the rare exception because she can abuse those 5-7 minutes where's it's strong the hardest. Cinderhulk+Black Cleaver->full tank simply trumps Warrior's->full tank. You'll be tankier AND you'll do more damage.

Because balancing this game is hard to do, the butterfly effect is massive, and buffs need to be gradual to find a good ground. It's mentioned before they need results from live servers to get a better understanding on changes as well.

Same as nerfing, only people act like a nerf means the end of the champion giving the impression it's overboard and the champion is now unusable (Which I will admit has occurred with some champions, but some for good reason {{champion:2}} {{champion:78}} {{champion:19}} )

If you are insisting every champion in this game is either overpowered or underpowered, you are very much wrong however.

For example, If we buff a champion, this champions buff could result in a rise of that champion, making him a FoTM, causing his counters, or champions that work well with him to also rise too, along with items suddenly being used different, maybe the buff made a certain item really strong on said champion, maybe because of his counters rising a certain item does well against this champion, and it continues branching out all over the place.

I don't think people realize that the slightest of changes to a champion aren't just in a boxed environment, league is a massive ass constantly changing ecosystem, and it's impossible to keep anything consistent and balanced without causing a problem someplace else.

Honestly, most of the times people declare a champion "dead" or "gutted", they're still fine. Then again, when Riot lovetaps champions, it's no surprise they have to nerf them again afterward (like how Riot took over a year to balance Kassadin even though he was permaban the entire time in all regions).
